content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are willing to take risks and are fairly comfortable with uncertainty. You tend to embrace new opportunities even if they involve some risk. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player with a risk-taking and adventurous approach, I would analyze the payoff structure of the game. The best outcome (45$) is achieved when both players choose R, but since we are playing against an anonymous player, it's hard to predict what they will do consistently.

However, considering the game has 75 rounds and there are only two possible choices, the probability of both players always picking the same option is very low. So, I would expect a mix of R and B selections over time.

In this situation, choosing B in each round would guarantee a payoff of 20$ for every round, which amounts to 1500$ over 75 rounds. On the other hand, if my opponent frequently chooses R, I could earn more by selecting R myself, since the payoff is higher when they choose B (40$ compared to 20$).

However, there's no way to predict with certainty how often my opponent will choose R or B. Therefore, to maximize my expected earnings over the long run and minimize risk, I would opt for a strategy that guarantees some return in every round rather than betting on potentially higher rewards. In other words, I would pick B in this game.
{B}
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.

In the next round, I will stick with my strategy and choose B again, aiming for consistent returns of 20$ per round over the long run. While it may seem that choosing R in certain rounds could potentially yield higher rewards, the unpredictability of my opponent's choices makes such a strategy riskier and less reliable. By consistently selecting B, I can minimize risk and guarantee a return in every round.
